required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diabetes Management Intervention For South Asians
clinical_study.official_title: Diabetes Management Intervention For South Asians

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness and implementation process of a multi-level, integrated intervention to decrease HbA1c among South Asians with uncontrolled diabetes, including four components: 1) an EHR-based registry function to increase identification of South Asian patients with uncontrolled diabetes; 2) CHW-led health coaching of registered patients to promote health behavior change; 3) HIT-enabled and CHW-facilitated identification and referral to culturally relevant community resources for patients; and 4) HIT-enabled care coordination between the CHW and other members of the healthcare team.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of patients that experience a reduction in HbA1c of >0.5%
primary_outcome.description: complete lipoprotein panel compared at baseline and 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Average reduction in hemoglobin A1c test (HbA1c)
secondary_outcome.description: complete blood panel compared at baseline and 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Average reduction in BMI (Body Mass Index)
secondary_outcome.description: Body mass index (BMI) is a measure of body fat based on height and weight that applies to adult men and women.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average reduction HDL (High density lipoprotein cholesterol)
secondary_outcome.description: complete lipoprotein panel compared at baseline and 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Average reduction LDL (Low density lipoprotein cholesterol)
secondary_outcome.description: complete lipoprotein panel compared at baseline and 6 months
Number of referrals given to community service over the course of 6 months

arm_group.description: Supportive care enabled by mobile devices.
Patient setting progress communicated to physician via PHI

intervention.description: Patients contacted a maximum of 10 times over 2 weeks to attend diabetes management sessions led by community health workers. Enrolled patients attend 5 Monthly group sessions led by a CHW held at the clinic

During one on one visit, CHWs will assess social needs of patients using mobile technology. CHWs will give referral sources to patients generated by mobile app, and they will track through mobile app.
Forms on patient goal setting and referrals made are uploaded into EHR to physician

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- South Asian ethnicity (identified through a race and language code available in the EHR);
- an appointment with a physician for routine non-emergent primary care in the last 12 months
- a diagnosis of diabetes for at least 12 months
- an HbA1c reading of >7 in the last 30 days
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women and visits to obstetrician/gynecologist are excluded from the study

overall_official.affiliation: New York University School of Medicine
